thread.title: Raising Cane's set for February opening in Canton
thread.title_full: Raising Cane's set for February opening in Canton

author: , Observer and Eccentric Newspapers and Hometown Weeklies
title: Raising Cane's set for February opening in Canton
text:
Raising Cane's set for February opening in Canton
CANTON TWP. — It’s official. The much-anticipated opening of Raising Cane’s is set for Tuesday, Feb. 4.
The fast-food restaurant, which serves a menu of chicken fingers, fries, coleslaw and Texas toast, was built at 44218 Ford Road after the former [TGI Fridays was torn down in April 2024.](https://www.hometownlife.com/story/news/2024/04/10/cantons-tgi-fridays-demolished-raising-canes/73280426007/)
The eatery will join seven other fast-food restaurants located within a half-mile of the site, including Arby’s, Wendy’s, Tim Hortons, Culver’s, Taco Bell, McDonald’s and Burger King.
Raising Cane’s is wildly popular. About 250 people [waited in line for Michigan’s first Raising Cane’s 2022 grand opening in East Lansing](https://www.hometownlife.com/story/news/2022/10/18/raising-canes-chicken-fingers-east-lansing-michigan-state-university-opening-sam-volk/69571194007/).
The company’s plans to build its second Michigan location in Canton generated much social media excitement [when news of the proposal broke in September](https://www.hometownlife.com/story/news/2023/09/12/raising-canes-canton-new-location-ford-road/70830842007/) 2023.
"We’re kicking off the new year in the best way possible—by opening our first Raising Cane’s in the Detroit area,” said Jennifer Szewc, Regional Leader of Restaurants. “Detroit has such a rich culture and vibrant energy and we’re ready to serve Motor City with the high-energy atmosphere and delicious food that’s made us famous."
The company said its Canton opening will be an all-out celebration. Twenty customers will be awarded with “Free Canes for a Year.” The company will also host community givebacks and more, the company said, noting it will engage with local schools, sports teams and non-profit organizations through fundraising opportunities and sponsorships.
Looking for a job? The company said in a press release it is recruiting crewmembers for its Canton Township location, the first in Metro Detroit.
Interested applicants can apply online by visiting [jobs.raisingcanes.com](http://jobs.raisingcanes.com).
Contact reporter Laura Colvin at lcolvin@hometownlife.com or 248-221-8143.
Get the latest headlines for metro Detroit every morning in your mailbox by signing up for [our daily briefings newsletter](https://profile.hometownlife.com/newsletters/manage/).
